formula: a(n)=sum((-1)^i*binomial(n, 2i+1)*E[n+4-2i], i=0..floor((n-1)/2)), where E[j]=A000111(j)=j!*[x^j]((sec(x)+tan(x)) are the up/down or Euler numbers. a(n)=T(n+5, n), where T is the triangle in A008282. - _Emeric Deutsch_, May 15 2004
maple: f:=sec(x)+tan(x): fser:=series(f,x=0,30): E[0]:=1: for n from 1 to 25 do E[n]:=n!*coeff(fser,x^n) od: a:=n->sum((-1)^i*binomial(n,2*i+1)*E[n+4-2*i],i=0..floor((n-1)/2)): seq(a(n),n=0..15);
mathematica: t[n_, 0] := If[n == 0, 1, 0]; t[n_ , k_ ] := t[n, k] = t[n, k - 1] + t[n - 1, n - k]; a[n_] := t[n + 5, n]; Array[a, 30, 0] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 12 2016 *)
